meanings.definition: A temporary structure used to support workers and materials during construction or repair.
meanings.sent1: The scaffolds were set up to help the workers build the new house.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers climbed the scaffolds to reach the top of the building.
meanings.sent3: The birds thought the scaffolds were a new playground and perched on them.
meanings.sent4: The scaffolds stood tall like giant ladders reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the scaffolds made them stand out against the gray building.

meanings.definition: A raised platform or stage used for public speaking or performance.
meanings.sent1: The speaker stood confidently on the scaffolds to address the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The actors rehearsed their lines on the theater scaffolds.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels mistook the wooden scaffolds for a treehouse and played on them.
meanings.sent4: The scaffolds transformed into a stage under the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The audience gasped as the performer leaped off the scaffolds into the crowd.

meanings.definition: A framework used to hold and display plants in a garden.
meanings.sent1: The metal scaffolds supported the climbing roses beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The gardeners arranged the flower pots on the wooden scaffolds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the garden scaffolds as a jungle gym.
meanings.sent4: The scaffolds in the garden created a green oasis of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The morning sunlight illuminated the delicate flowers on the garden scaffolds.
